name: Crystal Hotel

reviews.text: OK - so this isn't the Ritz or the Crillon. BUT, if you want to stay in the absolutely best location of the Quartier Latin and not have to worry about having to put on airs to communicate with the staff, this is well worth checking out. I have stayed in, probably, every room of this hotel since I found it about 20 years ago. Some rooms are better than others (typical of ANY European hotel that's been around for a LONG time and is family-owned). It is not your typical "box", modern, cubicle. The first time I stayed here was with a group of students and we left our extra luggage in the basement (WELL before the current breakfast room was built) while taking a trip outside of Paris. Since then I've stayed here several times, both with students AND adults and have found it "comfortable" and within walking distance of the Orsay, Louvre, Notre-Dame, Luxembourg Gardens, and the oldest streets of the city. If you are an antique buff, you'll love being in the center of the antique shop district. If you love fashion, Louis Vuitton is facing the hotel and there's a Dior shop around the corner. If you love cafés, Les Deux Magots and Café du Flore are withing 100 feet of the hotel entrance. Try the Petit St Benoît for a restaurant that still retains the ambiance of the days of Sartre.
reviews.title: My favorite Paris hotel - and I've traveled to Paris since 1969
A great hotel, but they're remodeling (but I still recommend staying here)
reviews.text: In a city where you can EASILY pay $600 per night for a room, you'll find the Crystal to be a jewel (sometimes in the rough, perhaps). Renovations have made this small hotel into one that is highly desirable and sometimes sold out - especially during the annual Antiques Fair season.

reviews.title: Great for the price
reviews.text: Madame Adda and her staff have always been extremely helpful with information and have made my trips to Paris more memorable with each visit.
As a parttime travel agent, I have sent many clients here. The overwhelming reaction has been positive.
reviews.title: Great Staff, Price, and Location

reviews.text: My main thing to add is that the hotel is being remodeled now. It looks as if half of it is closed down, and the front is covered by scaffolding, but you can still see out to the street through the mesh covering. There were workers outside our window only one day out of the 5 we were there, but it was Easter weekend, so that may not always be true. We weren't in Paris to hang out in the room, anyway. The location is fantastic. Our room was small, but clean(the smoke smell faded after a day or so), the bathroom was newly remodeled, clean, and had a bathtub...and actually quite big by Parisian hotel standards. Our room faced the street, but since it was on the top floor, the noise wasn't bothersome. There is a lift, but it only goes up to the 4th floor, so if you stay on the top (5th) floor, you'll have to carry your bags up the last flight. But you simply can't beat the location. Right in the middle of everything. And I'm looking forward to see how it looks when the remodeling is done. I'm glad we stayed at this hotel during our stay, and I would definitely stay here again. I have a feeling it is much better than other hotels in this price range.
reviews.title: Great Place To Stay In Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for four days in early June 2009. Overall the rooms, food and service was excellent and at St Moritz prices it was good value for money.
reviews.title: Do stay here, but it might be useful to know....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's not really any big "BUTS", but it may help reading closely previous reviewers comments, especially:-
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Location. The location is excellent, but central, so some traffic noise is to be expected - rooms get hot and we had to keep a window open all night.
reviews.title: Too noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. The hotel's restaurant, Grissini, is first rate and offers modern Italian style meals. The two Maitre d's are excellent. We prefered the Set Menu at CHF37 for 3 courses and CHF50 for 4 courses ( Antipasta, Pasta, Main and Dessert courses - coffee is extra ).
reviews.title: Can't go wrong with this hotel!

reviews.text: 3. In quiet periods such as June, the hotel has lots of package holiday guests, who have separate dining rooms for dinner, but not breakfast. This could be an issue if you are paying the rack rate and the Saga guests are paying a heavily discounted rate! Get a deal yourself and all will be fine!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in great location.
Not just a crystal- a GEM!--- Crystal Hotel Paris
reviews.text: My sister and I stayed at the Crystal Hotel for our two night visit to Paris. The service was great—they even watched our bags for the few hours before check-in because we had arrived early, and the entire day after check-out until we took a taxi to the train station. The staff is completely bilingual and very friendly. Our twin room was small but clean. I will now mention some of its drawbacks before getting to its good aspects which as you will see, far outweigh them. 1. Our room did not have a bathtub, but instead, a shower stall with a rather flimsy shower curtain. (But maybe soaking in a nice tub is not really all that necessary for short term travellers, or for Parisians.) 2. The ‘inner courtyard,’ which our room faced, is not really a yard but a shady cement space on the inside of the building (imagine a donut, and the hole in the middle is the ‘yard’). The hotel had made an effort to make it nicer, placing a statue and some flowers on the space on the ground floor, but nevertheless, it is a constantly dim shaft which sometimes echoes with sounds from the other rooms facing it. The room is adequate for sleeping in, but if one plans on spending a substantial amount of time in the room and would appreciate natural light and some sort of view of the outside, the ‘courtyard’ rooms are not recommended. We were on the second floor and got practically no sun at all. Also, the wireless internet connection which we purchased for 10 Euros for 24 hours was also very slow and fickle in the room, perhaps due to its location. There was, though, a public computer terminal right off of the lobby area (available for those who had paid for Internet).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly, let me say that the Crystal Hotel was one of the few places in the Engadine that allowed us to book for 3 nights over Xmas. As previous reviews have stated the hotel is very centrally located in the centre of St.Moritz and the corvigilia is only meters away.
reviews.title: Great hotel, but.......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are pleasant and spacious enough and are VERY traditional. We founf the temperature of the hotel to be very warm, slightly uncomfortable. We opened our window and that helped a great deal. I am not a great fan of the two single beds pushed together to make a queen and the bed was very hard. If only they would get a Sofitel kind of bed.
reviews.title: Welcoming hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gala dinner and service on the Xmas eve was fantastic and the service good. just a little pricey even for St.Moritz.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff

reviews.text: Service from the staff was courteous most of the time and in a town associated with the rich and famous this was a pleasant surprise. The breakfat was average and I don't believe it was anything special as previously commented.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff & Good Food

reviews.text: A handy feature was the internet access in the lobby albeit one station.The bar also attached to the hotel was also not in keeping with the hotels ambience. The crowd of ski instructors night after night becomes a little annoying but you can easily go to other places.
reviews.title: Friendly staff - Great location - Very comfortable room

likes.liked: — Friendly staff. Clean and well-kept hotel. Great location to go skiing.

reviews.text: Stayed with a tour group. Rooms were small but cute. Beth was surrounded by wood -3 sides - room had wood carvings in the ceiling and wood on the walls. Right in St. Moritz - call walk around the town. Kinda far from lake.
reviews.title: small but cute rooms..

reviews.text: Free internet in lobby was a plus
reviews.title: Adorable hotel
Short break in St. Moritz
reviews.text: oExcellent location, in the heart of the town and near two great eating places (Hanselmanns for pastries and Hausers for lunch)

reviews.title: Just ok
reviews.text: oI stayed in room 215 which had a double bed and a nice view looking over the small street below.

description: Welcome to the Hotel Crystal in the historical Saint-Germain district in the centre of Paris. Our hotel has been a famous meeting place for talents such as artists, writers or Nobel Prize laureates since the 1950’s. The recently refurbished reception area is spacious and light and our friendly staff will do their utmost to make your stay in Paris a memorable one.
